Elisabeth Amy Mayer, a daughter of Harriet and Richard Mayer of Manhattan, is to be married this evening to Jason Matthew Cooper, a son of Denise and Arnold Cooper of Manalapan, N.J. Rabbi Niles Goldstein is to officiate at Wave Hill in Riverdale, the Bronx.
The bride, 26, and the bridegroom, 25, graduated from Harvard University, she magna cum laude and he cum laude.

Ms. Mayer, who will keep her name, was until July a special projects associate at the Planned Parenthood Federation of America in Manhattan. Later this month, she is to begin a master's degree program in public policy at the Columbia University School of International and Public Affairs. Her father is a partner in Kenyon & Kenyon, a Manhattan law firm, and her mother is a librarian at Nightingale-Bamford, the private school for girls, also in Manhattan.

Mr. Cooper is to begin his second year at Columbia Law School next month. This year, he was a summer associate at Dechert, Price & Rhoads, a Manhattan law firm. Before attending law school, he was the new works coordinator for the National Alliance for Musical Theater, in Manhattan. His mother teaches Spanish at Intermediate School 24 in Great Kills, Staten Island. His father teaches science at Public School 3 in Pleasant Plains, Staten Island.
